title.rendered: Participate in our study on the Sustainable Development Goals

content.rendered:
In September 2015, the United Nations adopted 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) to end poverty, fight inequalities and injustice and address climate change by 2030. They are the result of an inclusive and ambitious process involving public and private actors, the solidarity sector and citizens. Yet the SDGs receive little media coverage and remain unknown to the large public.

What it is your vision of the SDGs? Do you feel concerned? Do you see yourself as an actor in the implementation of the SDGs? Convergences launches an exclusive ten-question survey to estimate how experts and the public appropriate the SDGs.

The results will be presented during the 9th Convergences World Forum, which takes place on the 5th, 6th and 7th of September 2016 in Paris. They will serve as a qualitative database to better raise awareness and mobilise around the SDGs.
